gurmukhi: bIrn Gwie kry jb hI qb paurK BUp kbMD smwrXo ] SsqR sMBwr qbY Apuny ien nwsu kro icq bIc ibcwrXo ]
transliteration: Bderan Ghaae Dare Jab Hitab Paurakh Bhoop Kabandh Samdaryo|| Shastra Sanbhaar Tabai Apoune In Naas(u) Daro Chit Beech Bichdaryo||
translation: When the warriors inflicted wounds, then the headless trunk of the king controlling his strength and taking up his weapons, thought of destroying the enemy in his mind;

gurmukhi: Dwie prXo iris isau rn mY Air Bwij gey jsu rwm aucwrXo ] qwrn ky mno mMfl BIqr sUr cFXo AMiDAwir isDwrXo ]1707]
transliteration: Dhaae Daryo Ris(i) Sio Ran Mai Ar(i) Bhaaj Gad Jas(u) Raam Ouchdaryo|| Taaran Ke Mano Mandal Bheetar Soor Chadhyo Andhdaryo||1707||
translation: He appeared to be like the moon amongst the stars and on the appeared of the moon, the dark ness fled away.1707.

gurmukhi: sRI jdubIr qy Awidk bIr gey Bij kY n koaU ThrwnXo ] Awhv BUim mY BUpiq ko sB sUrn mwnhu kwl pCwnXo ]
transliteration: Srijadoubeer Te Aadik Beer Gad Bhaj(i) Kai Na Ko( i)  Thahraanyo|| Oohav Bhoom(i) Mai Bhoopat(i) Ko Sabh Sooran Maanoh Kaal Pachhaadyo||
translation: The heroes like Krishna ran away, and none of the warriors stayed there; to all the warriors the king seemed like Kal (death);

gurmukhi: BUp kmwn qy bwn cly mno AMiq pRlY Gn isau brKwnXo ] ieau liK Bwij gey ishry iknhUM niRp ky sMg ju`Du n TwnXo ]1708]
transliteration: Bhoop Kamaan Te Baan Chale Mano Ant(i) Pralai Ghan Sio Barkhaanyo|| Io Lakh(i0 Bhaaj(i) Gad Sigre Kinhoon Nrip Ke San Juddh(u) Na Thaanyo||1708||
translation: All the arrows emanating from the bow of the king were being showered like clouds of the doomsday; seeing all this, all ran away and none of them fought with the king.1708.

gurmukhi: sB hI Bt Bwij gey jb hI pRB ko qb BUp BXo AnrwgI ] jUJ qbY iqn Cwif dXo hir iDAwn kI qwir smwiD sI lwgI ]
transliteration: Sabh Hibhat Bhaaj(i) Gad Jab Hiprabh Ko Tab Bhoop Bhayo Anraagee|| Joojh Tabai Tin Chhaad(i) Dayo Har(i) Dhiaan Kidaar(i) Smaadh(i) Silaagee||
translation: When all the warriors ran away, the king then remembered the Lord and forsaking the fighting, he absorbed himself with the devotion of the Lord;

gurmukhi: rwjn rwj smwj ibKY kib sXwm khY hir mY mq pwgI ] DIr gihE Dr TwFo rhXo kho BUpiq qy Ab ko bfBwgI ]1709]
transliteration: Raajan Raaj Samaaj Bikhai Kabi Syaam Kahai Har(i) Mai Mat Paagee|| Dheer Gadio Dhar Thaadho Rahyo Kaho Bhoopat(i) Te Ab Ko Bad-bhaagee||1709||
translation: In that society of the kings, the mind of the king Kharag Singh became absorbed in the Lord; he is firmly standing on the earth; who else is so fortunate like the king?1709.

gurmukhi: sRI jdubIr ko bIr sBo Dr fwrin ko jb Gwq bnwXo ] sXwm Bny imil kY iPir kY ieh pY puin bwnin EG clwXo ]
transliteration: Srijadoubeer Ko Beer Sabho Dhar Daaran(i) Ko Jab Ghaat Banaayo|| Syaam Bhane Mil(i) Kai Phir(i) Kai Eh Pai Poun(i) Baanan(i) Ogh Chalaayo||
translation: When the warriors of Krishna thought of getting the king fall on the ground and at the same time discharged clusters of arrows on him;

gurmukhi: dovbDU imil kY sBhU ieh BUp kbMD ibvwn cFwXo ] kUd prXo n ibvwn cFXo puin SsqR lIey rn BU miD AwXo ]1710]
transliteration: Dev-badhoo Mil(i) Kai Sabh-hoo Eh Bhoop Kabandh Bivaan Chadhaayo|| Kood Daryo Na Bivaan Chadhyo Poun(i) Shastra Leee Ran Bhoo Madh(i) Aayo||1710||
translation: All the women of the gods together lifted and put the trunk of the king on the air-vehicle, but still he jumped down from the vehicle and taking his weapons reached the battlefield.1710.

gurmukhi: DnuK bwn lY pwn mY Awn prXo rn bIc ] sUrbIr bhu ibD hnY llkwrXo qb mIc ]1711]
transliteration: Dhanoukh Baan Lai Paan Mai Aan Daryo Ran Beech|| Soorbeer Bahu Beedh Hanai Lalkdaryo Tab Meech||1711||
translation: Taking his bow and arrows in his hands he reached the battlefield and killing many warriors, he began to challenge death.1711.
